intro: Pultenaea millarii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, pea-like flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. This variety is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to other varieties of Pultenaea millarii.
